image.altText: Train level crossing near miss in Tasmania's north-west

props.synopsis: Tasmania's rail operator, TasRail, has called for increased action on level crossing safety after a truck narrowly avoided a serious crash with a train.

title.children: Truck narrowly avoids crash with oncoming train in Tasmania

image.altText: The Prime Minister stands in a leafy green area holding a press conference

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese says Operation Sovereign Borders is working as intended and the arrival of a boat carrying asylum seekers on WA's shore is "unfortunate" but not a policy failure.

title.children: Albanese says asylum seeker boat arrival 'unfortunate' but rubbishes claims government to blame

image.altText: A young woman and man smile while holding a dog.

props.synopsis: The Tasmanian Liberals announce a series of election commitments designed to increase tenants' rights and boost the supply of rental properties.

title.children: Renters won't have to give up their pets under scheme promised during Tasmanian election

image.altText: a couple stands under an umbrella overlooking the sydney harbour bridge as strom clouds brew

props.synopsis: The ambulance service says the group — a teenage male, a woman in her 20s, and a man and woman in their 30s— was standing under a tree when the lightning struck just before 1pm.

title.children: Four people knocked unconscious by lightning strike outside Sydney's Botanic Gardens during heavy storm

image.altText: A man sitting in a chair wearing a suit and tie.

props.synopsis: Candidates are being finalised for Tasmania's upcoming state election. For many, it's not their first rodeo.

title.children: Ten more seats are up for grabs. But will Tasmania get fresh faces or party stalwarts?

image.altText: A person wheels their trolley past the end of a supermarket aisle. They are blurred from the motion and are not identifiable.

props.synopsis: Leaked emails reveal for the first time the tactics Coles employs when a supplier seeks a price increase and how it has taken advantage of inflation to boost profits.

title.children: You've been paying more at the checkout: Four Corners reveals the tactics used by Coles and Woolworths

image.altText: Woman and dog wrapped in muslin cloth

props.synopsis: Struggling to pay rent in Sydney, Alys McDonough bought what she says was one of the cheapest houses in Australia. She's now back living there, with no mains power and with a bit of ceiling missing, but she says she's sorted.

title.children: Struggling to pay rent, Alys bought a dilapidated house in the outback for about $12,000

image.altText: A man drives a forklift that is carrying three yellow poles surrounded by other metal.

props.synopsis: A Victorian court hears a Melbourne employer is filled with "sadness and guilt" after a few seconds of negligence resulted in the death of employee Michael Tsahrelias at his stonemasonry business in Melbourne's north.

title.children: 'I never thought it'd be that dangerous': Guilt, remorse and $1.3m fine after workplace death

image.altText: White rocket sits in hangar with Australian flag in background.

props.synopsis: A Queensland-built rocket will strive to reach orbit from the northern town of Bowen in what company bosses say is the first locally made craft to lift-off from Australian soil.

title.children: First glimpse of historic rocket set to launch Australia into the space age

image.altText: Two sisters hug and smile for the camera.

props.synopsis: A girl seriously injured in a car crash that resulted in the death of her sister in a family road trip to a Taylor Swift concert is in a critical but stable condition, her godmother says.

title.children: 'In the best place possible': Bedside vigil for girl critically injured in crash that killed sister on Taylor Swift trip

image.altText: A man dressed in police uniform and holding a gun stands on a street with cars nearby.

props.synopsis: Papua New Guinea police have revised the death toll in a massacre in the country's highlands to 26.

title.children: At least 26 people killed in a major escalation of tribal fighting in PNG's highlands

image.altText: Sue Kole in her backyard hugging her dog

props.synopsis: Plans to build a co-located private hospital at the Launceston General Hospital have been shelved just months before construction was due to start — with fears that will make Tasmania's growing waiting lists worse.

title.children: Sue's long wait for breast reconstruction surgery will get longer as hospital plans are dumped

image.altText: Hobart CBD buildings seen from a plane window.

props.synopsis: For six years, the Tasmanian Liberals have resisted adding further regulation to Airbnb and Stayz. But as hundreds of properties continue to be taken out of the rental market, they have decided to introduce a levy — to be paid by the visitor, not the owner.

title.children: Liberals promise a levy on Airbnb in Tasmania, saying short stay is impacting rental supply

image.altText: A woman with short hair smiling as she holds up a bucket filled with gooseberries.

props.synopsis: There are lots of berries to discover beyond blueberries, blackberries and raspberries, Tasmanian farmer Olivia Rundle tells her visitors.

title.children: Have you heard of tayberries and jostaberries? Some of the least-known berries are the best, according to this Tassie farmer

image.altText: Family home Nita Rojewski

props.synopsis: Granddaughter Kate Bishop hopes the 90th birthday road trip will inspire other families to seize the moment and celebrate their loved one.

title.children: Tasmanian birthday road trip ticks off milestones for Nita's 90th

image.altText: ian wilkinson

props.synopsis: Pastor Ian Wilkinson has delivered a sermon to his church for the first time speaking publicly since his world was turned upside down.

title.children: Mushroom meal survivor breaks his silence six months since his wife died from mushroom poisoning

image.altText: Supporters hold signs and flags at a pro-Palestine rally outside Parliament House in Canberra.

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese has been trying to play the role of unifier when it comes to the conflict in the Middle East and the schisms it's causing in Australia. But as community tensions rise, so do frustrations about where this all ends, writes Patricia Karvelas.

title.children: Something disturbing is going on in Australian communities — and it's sparking many conversations in Canberra

image.altText: Billie Eilish, Sydney Sweeney, and America Ferrera at the Peoples Choice Awards red carpet in their outfits

props.synopsis: The awards which brings together the biggest names in movies, television, music and pop culture in general. Here's some of the looks we've seen so far.

title.children: Kylie Minogue, Billie Eilish and G Flip hit the Peoples Choice Awards red carpet

image.altText: A smiling woman with short hair next to a man whose face is blurred

props.synopsis: Raelene Polymiadis, who is accused of murdering her elderly parents by allegedly injecting them with her own insulin, indicates she will fight breach of bail charges against her.

title.children: Woman accused of murdering elderly parents will dispute breach of bail charges, court hears

image.altText: A composite image of Taylow Swift on stage and Travis Kelce in his NFL uniform.

props.synopsis: Here are the winners from the People's Choice Awards, where Barbie beat Oppenheimer and Taylor Swift, before Swift bounced back in a host of other categories.

title.children: Here are all the People's Choice Awards winners, updated live

image.altText: David Warner and another man perform a hongi, with their foreheads touching

props.synopsis: Departing great David Warner calls for a renewal of the trans-Tasman rivalry after a drought of Australian teams touring New Zealand, despite some unfriendly memories of his last visit.

title.children: Warner calls for more Australian tours of New Zealand, despite memories of 'personal' sledging

image.altText: Young woman doing her makeup in front of the mirror. She holds a fluffy makeup brush and has a headband in her hair.

props.synopsis: Wearing makeup every day is fun for some and a chore for others. Either way, you may have wondered if your skin is suffering because of it.

title.children: Does wearing makeup every day harm or age your skin?

image.altText: Christopher Walker arrives at court wearing sunglasses

props.synopsis: Twenty-one-year-old Christopher Walker has been spared jail time after stealing a car and crashing it into traffic on the Sydney Harbour Bridge while on drugs.

title.children: Driver of stolen car in fiery Sydney Harbour Bridge crash escapes jail time

image.altText: Woman's face.

props.synopsis: A new coronial inquest has been scheduled into the disappearance of the young Sydney woman who failed to meet her mother at Newcastle Railway Station in 1994.

title.children: Thirty years on, answers sought over fate of missing model Revelle Balmain

image.altText: Christian Horner, in a Red Bull branded jacket with headphones around his neck, in the pit garage.

props.synopsis: Pressure is mounting on Formula 1's world champions, as allegations of workplace misconduct hover over the new season.

title.children: F1 calls for end to Red Bull, Horner turmoil at 'earliest opportunity'

image.altText: An office worker is reflected in a stock board at the ASX while he talks on the phone.

props.synopsis: Gains in the mining sector are offsetting widespread losses on the ASX 200, effectively cancelling each other out, as the ASX turns flat in mid-afternoon trade. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX flattens out despite best efforts from mining sector, as Lend Lease dives on earnings update

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Are companies a little too optimistic?
Not just domestic news boosting mine stocks today

image.altText: Two women seated on couch with toddler girl. The hands of a photographer are blurred in foreground

props.synopsis: After the Matildas’ World Cup glory, star midfielder Katrina Gorry introduces us to the tiny secret weapon who rekindled her love for the game.

title.children: At the top of her game but battling to get out of bed, Katrina Gorry reveals how she overcame her 'dark place'

image.altText: A woman comforts a depressed-looking man.

props.synopsis: Julia Navalnaya will meet European foreign ministers in Brussels as world leaders hold Vladimir Putin responsible for Alexei Navalny's unexplained death in a Russian penal colony.

title.children: Alexei Navalny's widow to meet EU ministers as world pays tribute

image.altText: Ben Stokes

props.synopsis: Yashasvi Jaiswal scores his second Test century in a row as India hands England a 434-run defeat in the third Test of their series.

title.children: England falls to worst Test defeat since WWII as Bazball tactics face ongoing scrutiny

image.altText: A woman standing in front of a book shelf.

props.synopsis: The general insurance industry's delaying and denying of claims and low-balling of cash settlement offers in the aftermath of the 2022 floods weren't isolated — the tactics are rife across the sector, writes Adele Ferguson.

title.children: General insurers use a variety of dirty tricks to knock back claims. A slew of harrowing stories show it's getting worse

image.altText: A retro motel in the 50's, large American styles signage decorates the front and an old car is parked out the front

props.synopsis: Across Australia many motel restaurants once a hive of activity 50 years ago are being used as storage, conference rooms, or common rooms. But what changed?

title.children: What ever happened to the golden age of motel dining?

image.altText: A man stands between two dairy cows patting their necks in a pddock.

props.synopsis: Gippsland dairy farmer Bruce Manintveld, 50, who died in severe storms on Tuesday afternoon, has been remembered as a generous man who shared his knowledge with younger farmers.

title.children: Victorian community grieves farmer who died trying to save his cows from wild storm

image.altText: Jockey James McDonald rides the Melbourne Cup winning horse Verry Elleegant at Flemington

props.synopsis: The racing world is in mourning after Verry Elleegant — who won two-thirds of Australian racing's big three distance races including the Melbourne Cup — dies in France from complications giving birth to a foal.

title.children: Melbourne Cup winner Verry Elleegant dies giving birth
